alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Big Horn; Northern Stillwater; Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 14 at 1:57AM MST until February 14 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Billings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 6 inches. Locally higher amounts to 8 inches south of Interstate 90. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Northeastern Yellowstone, Northern Big Horn, Northern Stillwater, and Southwestern Yellowstone. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will taper off early this afternoon. Blowing snow will be a hazard into this evening.
info.instruction: Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. For the latest road conditions, call 5 1 1. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Big Horn; Northern Stillwater; Southwestern Yellowstone
